alert.note: Alert for Orange; Spotsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 4:31PM EDT until June 17 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Orange County in central Virginia... Southern Spotsylvania County in central Virginia... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 431 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Orange, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Orange, Spotsylvania, Brokenburg, Montpelier Station, Madison Run, Snell, Alsop, Gatewood, Thornhill, Nasons, Logan, Partlow, Montford, Lahore, Glenora, Post Oak, Thornburg, Unionville, Somerset and Madison Mills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
